ch.unige.ng.species
Interface Individual<T>

All Superinterfaces:
Copiable<GlobalIndividual<T>>, Evaluable<T>, GlobalIndividual<T>, java.lang.Iterable<T>
All Known Subinterfaces:
VariableSize<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
VariableSizeIndividual, VectorIndividual
public interface Individual<T>
extends GlobalIndividual<T>

This interface represent a common base for each linear Individual. The individual have to be either with a Gene prototype pattern or with a Gene factory.

It is not a good idea to create a new Individual using the new keyWord. You should use the method emptyCopy. The goal is to handle the memory in an optimized way.

This class should be used with the interface Poolable.

Version:
An individual is no more iterable.
Author:
Jean-Luc Falcone
See Also:
Poolable
